rationale: The agent's changes address the core confusing wording issue (how the timeout works) but go beyond what was requested. Ground truth made minimal, focused changes to clarify the timeout behavior in the example paragraph (lines 38-43). The agent made the same core fix but also: (1) removed 'high water-mark' terminology (not requested), (2) added explanatory text about immediate return, (3) modified the timeout parameter documentation (lines 77-79) which wasn't part of the task scope. While these extra changes do improve clarity, they constitute unsolicited documentation additions that weren't in the task instructions 'fix the confusing wording in the cluster health timeout documentation' when interpreted against the ground truth scope. The core fix is correct and improves upon ground truth slightly with 'will return immediately' being clearer than 'will return at that point', but the additional scope expansion warrants penalty.
ground_truth_patch:
diff --git a/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc b/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
index 52685de9f48..48108e145be 100644
--- a/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
+++ b/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
@@ -38,9 +38,9 @@ status is controlled by the worst index status.
 
 One of the main benefits of the API is the ability to wait until the
 cluster reaches a certain high water-mark health level. For example, the
-following will wait till the cluster reaches the `yellow` level for 50
-seconds (if it reaches the `green` or `yellow` status beforehand, it
-will return):
+following will wait for 50 seconds for the cluster to reach the `yellow`
+level (if it reaches the `green` or `yellow` status before 50 seconds elapse,
+it will return at that point):
 
 [source,js]
 --------------------------------------------------
